newsitem.title: USA: Roberts Pharm submits Agrylin for EU okay.
newsitem.headline: Roberts Pharm submits Agrylin for EU okay.

text.p: Roberts Pharmaceutical Corp said Wednesday it submitted a Manufacturing Authorization Application (MAA) for European approval of its new drug, Agrylin.
The application has been filed with the European Medicines Evaluation Agency (EMEA) for approval within the 15-country European Union (EU).

In late March of 1997, the Food and Drug Administration approved the U.S. marketing of Agrylin (anagrelide HCl) as the first drug indicated for treating essential thrombocythemia, a life-threatening condition characterized by elevated blood platelet levels.
The drug is currently also under review for potential approval in Canada where the Health Protection Branch has given Agrylin "Priority Review" status, the company said.
